intro: Chaetogastra inconstans, commonly known as the variable featherleaf, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features small, tubular flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It has slender, hairy stems and narrow, feather-like leaves that give it its common name. Chaetogastra inconstans is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun.
